Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Data&AI, Machine Learning Team)
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.

More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams . We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster !

Machine Learning Engineer (Data&AI, Machine Learning Team)

As a Machine Learning Engineer within the Data&AI department, you will be at the forefront of developing and refining machine learning models that drive key aspects of our business. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Product and Engineering teams, to deliver impactful solutions across various domains, from personalized product recommendations and ad relevance to pricing optimization, sales forecasting, or inventory management. Your role will involve both research and hands-on model development, ensuring our algorithms remain innovative and scalable in a fast-paced environment.

What You’ll Have To Do


Develop cutting-edge techniques for fields like search, personalization, advertising, forecasting, optimization, and agent-based automation.
Dive deep into massive datasets, uncovering hidden patterns and insights through exploratory analysis and advanced analytical techniques.
Design and build machine learning models using state-of-the-art techniques, adapting them for real-world production environments and optimizing for business needs and engineering constraints.
Write high-quality production code for training and inference, ensuring seamless data validation, efficient logging, reliable exception handling, and smooth orchestration for optimal performance.


What Makes You a Good Fit


Have a degree in a related discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science).
Have hands-on experience with TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Are proficient in SQL and have a solid understanding of relational databases.
Have a passion for diving into large datasets, asking the right questions, and uncovering insights.
Have strong problem-solving skills, especially when it comes to complex technical challenges.
Can clearly communicate technical concepts and translate them into business-focused insights for both technical and management audiences.
Have expertise in areas like Anomaly Detection, Time Series Analysis, Unsupervised Learning, Probabilistic Graphical Models, Recommender Systems, and Semantic Search.
Have a strong collaborative mindset, working seamlessly with interdisciplinary teams to tackle tough problems.
Have a solid grasp of big data architecture and application design.


What We’ve Prepared For You


Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Descripción del empleo

En Veolia España buscamos incorporar un/a Data Scientist reportando al Director Information Systems and Technology para nuestras oficinas centrales en Madrid.

Si estás interesado/a en participar en el proceso de selección, ¡Inscríbete aquí!

Funciones


Diseño, desarrollo, optimización e implementación de modelos predictivos y algoritmos de IA para optimización energética utilizando Python, TensorFlow y Scikit-learn.
Programación y desarrollo de soluciones utilizando herramientas de vanguardia y tendencias actuales (Python, R, ...).
Diseño y mantenimiento de sistemas de monitoreo en tiempo real con integración IoT-SCADA y visualización en Qsense/Power BI/Grafana.
Análisis avanzado de datos de consumo energético y desarrollo de forecasting para optimización de costos.
Implementación de soluciones cloud (AWS/GCP/AZURE) para procesamiento de big data industrial
Creación y mantenimiento de dashboards y KPIs para seguimiento de eficiencia energética y sostenibilidad.


Se ofrece


Horario: Entrada flexible de 07:30 a 09:30
Modelo híbrido de trabajo.
Retribución flexible: Seguro médico, ticket restaurant, ticket guardería, tarjeta transporte.


Requisitos


Formación: Deseable grado Universitario en Ingeniería Informática, Licenciatura en Matemáticas, Fisica, o similares.
Experiencia: Al menos 2 años en las funciones anteriores
Idiomas: Inglés alto
Lugar de trabajo: c/ Santa Leonor, 39, Madrid


Información adicional

Como empresa inclusiva, Veolia está comprometida con la diversidad y valora todas las solicitudes sin discriminación.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Data Scientist with expertise in document analysis, leveraging LLMs (Large Language Models) and rule-based algorithms to extract, process, and analyze structured and unstructured data. You will work on cutting-edge solutions involving Azure Document Intelligence, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and Knowledge Graphs, helping to drive innovation in document automation.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and optimize document analysis applications using LLMs and rule-based techniques.
Process and extract data from PDF, Excel, and Word files.
Implement RAG pipelines to enhance retrieval and reasoning capabilities.
Utilize Azure Document Intelligence for document automation.
Design and maintain Knowledge Graphs for structured data representation.
Build and optimize REST APIs for document processing applications.
Ensure strong coding practices and scalable software development in Python.
Work with SQL databases to store and manage extracted information.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate findings effectively.

Core Skills & Qualifications

Python (strong programming experience)
SQL & general database knowledge
Experience handling PDF, Excel, and Word files
Familiarity with LLM APIs (OpenAI, etc.)
Expertise in Azure Document Intelligence
Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
Knowledge Graphs for structured data modeling
Experience with REST APIs & software development
Strong analytical and communication skills

Nice-to-Have Skills

Databricks experience
Understanding of insurance and cyber topics

Show more

Title: Junior Data Scientist [Ral fino a 38k]
Description:
📢 SIAE sta ampliando il proprio team di Junior Data Scientist!

Unisciti al nuovo progetto innovativo di SIAE: lavorerai su analisi avanzate e sviluppo di soluzioni di Generative AI, partecipando a un Hackathon dedicato e a una Academy esclusiva su AI Engineering in collaborazione con Datapizza.




RAL: fino a 38K

📚 Esperienza: 0-1 anni

📌 Modalità di lavoro: Ibrido su Roma – 10 giorni smart working/mese




Il ruolo prevede:

👉🏼 Analisi e modellazione dati

👉🏼 Sviluppo modelli ML per previsioni e automazioni

👉🏼 Estrazione e analisi dati con SQL

👉🏼 Collaborazione con i team per soluzioni di Generative AI




Fa per te se:

✅ Hai fino a 1 anno di esperienza in Data Science

✅ Conosci SQL e strumenti di Data Analytics

✅ Sei analitico/a e curioso/a

✅ Parli inglese B2+




📍 Lavoro Ibrido – 10 giorni smart working/mese




🔎 Iter selettivo:

1️⃣ Test attitudinale

2️⃣ Hackathon

3️⃣ Colloquio finale

Unisciti al nuovo progetto innovativo di SIAE: lavorerai su analisi avanzate e sviluppo di soluzioni di Generative AI, partecipando a un Hackathon dedicato e a una Academy esclusiva su AI Engineering in collaborazione con Datapizza.

Il ruolo prevede:

👉🏼 Analisi e modellazione dati

👉🏼 Sviluppo modelli ML per previsioni e automazioni

👉🏼 Collaborazione con i team per soluzioni di Generative AI


Fa per te se:

📍 Lavoro Ibrido – 10 giorni smart working/mese

Title: Data Scientist | Lisboa
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


• DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


• DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


• DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term values.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Scientist.


Requirements:

  • Previous professional experience as a Data Scientist or a similar role;
  • Proven knowledge and experience in Machine Learning, NLP, and text dataset curation;
  • Hands-on experience in coding for real-world data analytics applications;
  • Experience in NLP tasks, such as Text Classification, NER, and Information Retrieval;
  • Experience working with LLMs, OpenAI API (or equivalent), and RAG;
  • Proficiency in Python and ML/DL packages (PyTorch, NumPy, Scikit-Learn, Pandas);
  • Solid mathematical foundations and experience in statistical consultancy;
  • Strong business sense with the ability to quickly understand use cases;
  • Familiarity with data engineering, modeling, and business analysis;
  • Fluency in English;
  • Knowledge of cloud tools such as Azure, AWS, Google Cloud (plus);
  • Experience with MLOPs practices (plus).


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to catia.carvalho@decskill.com, with the reference “CC/DS”.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist (12-Month Contract, Fully Remote in the EU)




Compensation: $5,000 USD per month (Gross)




Job Overview:

We are seeking a Data Scientist to develop data-powered services that enhance our product, Subito, making it smarter and more intuitive. You will apply advanced analytics, statistical modeling, and machine learning techniques to extract valuable insights from vast datasets. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you will design and deploy innovative solutions that optimize user experiences and drive key business metrics.




Key Responsibilities:

Drive data-driven product design by analyzing multiple data sources to generate insights and recommendations.
Develop, train, and deploy Machine Learning models to improve user engagement and optimize business performance.
Leverage diverse datasets (in collaboration with Data Engineers) to uncover patterns and deliver actionable intelligence.
Formulate hypotheses and design experiments to validate and refine model performance in production environments.
Democratize data across the organization by creating automated reports and dashboards for key stakeholders.




Experience & Qualifications:

3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist working with large datasets in production environments.
Strong foundation in applied statistical techniques, model building, and hypothesis testing.
Mastery of Python for data manipulation and ML frameworks (pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, etc.), with familiarity in prototyping tools like Streamlit.
Hands-on experience designing, training, and deploying ML models at scale.
Advanced data extraction skills using SQL, Spark, and related technologies.
Familiarity with software development tools (Cloud infrastructure, Git, Docker, etc.) and best practices.
Experience building and optimizing large-scale data pipelines and ETL processes with Spark.
Knowledge of CI/CD for ML, experiment tracking, and model serving (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow).
Git: Proficient in branching, merging, and pull request workflows.
Docker: Experience in containerizing ML solutions for efficient development and deployment.
Ability to lead projects from conception to production with minimal supervision.
Strong collaboration skills to work effectively with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders.
Advanced English level (written and verbal communication).




Nice to Have:

Terraform: Basic exposure to Infrastructure as Code principles for automating resource provisioning.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Fecha: 15 mar 2025

Ubicación

MADRID, M, ES, 28049

Empresa: GRUPO AUDIOVISUAL MEDIASET ESPAÑA C.

Actualmente buscamos incorporar un Data Scientist para formar parte de nuestro equipo. La persona que se incorpore se integrará dentro del equipo de Desarrollo del dato, donde participará en el desarrollo de proyectos de data para las diferentes empresas del grupo Mediaset España.

Entre Sus Principales Funciones, Destacan


El análisis de datos y creación de insights/KPIs.
La implementación de trabajos de tratamiento de datos.
El desarrollo de proyectos de modelización avanzada, entre otros.


Requisitos

Formación académica/complementaria


Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería Matemática, Ingeniería de Datos o grados afines.


Idiomas

Nivel de inglés C1

Experiencia profesional


Al menos cuatro años de experiencia en el desarrollo de proyectos con tratamiento de datos.
Imprescindible contar con experiencia o conocimientos avanzados de SQL y Python.
Deseable experiencia en modelización, entornos cloud y metodologías MLOPS/DEVOPS.
Deseable experiencia o conocimientos en Sagemaker, Snowflake, SAS, AWS S3, Athena, AWS Lambda.


¿Qué ofrecemos?


Buen ambiente laboral donde te sentirás parte del equipo desde el primer día.
Condiciones salariales adaptadas a tu perfil.
Otros beneficios de compañía tales como: entorno de trabajo híbrido, seguro médico, comedor de empresa, retribución flexible, becas de estudio, medidas de conciliación, y mucho más.


Mediaset España mantiene su compromiso y responsabilidad con la igualdad de oportunidades y su lucha contra la discriminación en cualquier de sus formas. Por ello, se valorarán en el proceso a todos los solicitantes que cumplan con los requisitos solicitados independientemente de su condición.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are Landskill and we are looking for new members to join our team. If you’re reading this, you already know you want to change your professional life and you have landed in the right place.

What are we looking for? People who love technology and, above all, love to learn. And we get it - keeping our team motivated and happy is the key to staying successful. That’s why we’re so dedicated to making sure our work environment is always a top priority.

Do you want to work in a transparent company with opportunities tailored to you? Just make sure you have the right skill, and guarantee the perfect project to scale your career.

If you’re a Data Scientist and want to be part of a team working to grow together, we’re actively looking for you.

What we’re looking for:


Experience in exploratory data analysis, testing hypotheses, and building predictive models
Strong background in probability theory and statistics, data mining, and machine learning
Experience in Python and Cloud environment
Strong knowledge of data backup, recovery, security, integrity and SQL
Fluent in spoken and written English


What we offer:


Close-knit culture based on empathy and inclusion, with guidance from management teams
Training and professional/personal development program, along with a career plan tailored to you
Feedback culture and performance management system with regular meetings
We value new ideas and identifying areas for improvement, so your opinion matters to us
Events to get to know each other better and foster team spirit
Referral program rewarding your contribution to the team's growth and success


Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
AGILEX, azienda di consulenza informatica, è alla ricerca di:

Data Scientist




La figura sarà inserita per progetti interni o per progetti su commessa da parte dei nostri clienti.




CARATTERISTICHE DEL CANDIDATO:

Sviluppo di modelli di similarità per la classificazione di brevi testi
Esperienza nel ruolo di Data Scientist
Esperienza nello sviluppo e messa in produzione di progetti NLP
Esperienza nello sviluppo in Python
Conoscenza di piattaforme di Cloud Computing
Capacità di scrivere codice robusto e production-oriented, comprensivo di test
Conoscenza base di Kubernetes
Esperienza con l’analisi di testi bancari




COSA OFFRIAMO:

inserimento con contratto d'assunzione: retribuzione e inquadramento saranno commisurati al percorso di studio/lavoro e alle skills dimostrate
Ambiente di lavoro sfidante e collaborativo




Completano il profilo una personalità dinamica e proattiva, buone doti di comunicazione, di pianificazione e organizzazione, ottime doti di problem solving e capacità relazionali e di team working.




Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03 e a persone appartenenti alle categorie protette (L. 68/99)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
¡En @Ayesa crecemos juntos! 🚀 ✨




Cada profesional de nuestra empresa es importante para nosotros, nos ayudan a crecer de manera diversa y gracias a ellos somos más de 13.000 personas trabajando con el mismo objetivo en más de 40 países.

Si eres una persona entusiasta, te apasiona la #tecnología y buscas un nuevo reto profesional ¡Este es tu sitio!

Buscamos ampliar nuestro equipo con un/a Data Scientist para incorporase en el área de Data & IA para un proyecto de uno de nuestros clientes bancarios en nuestras oficinas de 📍Madrid en modalidad híbrida (disponibilidad en otras zonas geográficas).




¡Anímate a dar el salto!¡Te estamos esperando!




Funciones:

Te incorporarás para a un equipo multidisciplinar dentro de un proyecto de un cliente del sector banca. Las funciones a desarrollar son:




Desarrollar herramientas de software, principalmente en Python, enfocadas en el tratamiento de datos.
Resolución de incidencias: apoyo usuarios, dudas técnicas, incidencias en circuitos de integración continua, etc.
Crear y compartir documentación clara y accesible para favorecer la adopción de nuestras herramientas.
Aportar soporte en formación a otros países y equipos con diferente nivel técnico.




Requisitos imprescindibles:

Programar eficientemente en Python y Pyspark, enfocándose en automatización y modularización.
Optimizar funciones matemáticas bajo condiciones específicas.
Interpretar las necesidades del negocio y proponer soluciones, explorando herramientas BI como Quicksight (AWS).




Deseable:

Conocimientos sobre Amazon Web Services y/o disposición para aprender.
Flexibilidad para involucrarse en tareas de gestión interna cuando sea necesario.




Te ofrecemos un camino lleno de aventuras:

🔹 ¡Llega hasta donde tú quieras! Crece con nuestros programas de desarrollo! Te ayudaremos a marcar tu itinerario de futuro anualmente participando en proyectos vanguardistas con los mejores profesionales del sector.

🔹 Porque lo importante sois tú y los tuyos : contamos con políticas que facilitan la conciliación entre la vida profesional y personal: Flexibilidad horaria, Smart Job y jornada intensiva en verano.

🔹 Tú decides cómo usar tu dinero: disfruta de nuestra retribución flexible, contamos con: Seguro médico, Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte.

🔹 Plan Bienestar descuentos en viajes, tecnología, formación, deporte, belleza y ¡muchos más.

🔹 Diviértete participando en los diferentes concursos y actividades que organizamos: ¿te gusta el deporte, escribir, la fotografía? Todo tiene cabida.

🔹¡Actualízate! apostamos por un aprendizaje continuo, contamos con formación especializada, certificaciones e idiomas.

🔹¡Deja tu huella! Impacta con nuestros proyectos de voluntariado social.

¡Únete a la multinacional española tecnológica referente en el mundo! 💫🌎




Atendiendo a la Ley Orgánica 3/2007, de 22 de marzo, Ayesa se ha marcado como objetivo promover la defensa y aplicación efectiva del principio de igualdad entre hombres y mujeres, evitando cualquier tipo de discriminación laboral por razón de sexo, garantizando así las mismas oportunidades de ingreso. Asimismo, fomentamos la diversidad, rechazando cualquier tipo de discriminación por razones de raza, sexo, diversidad funcional, religión, orientación sexual, identidad sexual, o cualquier otra condición personal o social, apostando por construir un entorno inclusivo y enriquecedor.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

NielsenIQ is a consumer intelligence company that delivers the Full View™, the world’s most complete and clear understanding of consumer buying behavior that reveals new pathways to growth. Since 1923, NIQ has moved measurement forward for industries and economies across the globe. We are putting the brightest and most dedicated minds together to accelerate progress. Our diversity brings out the best in each other so we can leave a lasting legacy on the work that we do and the people that we do it with. NielsenIQ offers a range of products and services that leverage Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to provide insights into consumer behavior and market trends. This position opens the opportunity to apply the latest state of the art in AI/ML and data science to global and key strategic projects.

Job Description

As a Data Scientist, you will contribute to develop end-to-end analytic solutions, shaping data and algorithms to deliver accurate and robust Predictive and Prescriptive Analytics. You will work within a cross functional team composed of machine learning engineers, developers and client solution experts.

You will be part of the Global Data Science, a team of 40+ Scientists based in Nuremberg, Kuala Lumpur and Warsaw with diverse backgrounds. Always eager to learn and share experience, the team is a great environment for your self-development.

Your Mission:


Develop end-to-end analytical products
Work with GfK's Point of Sale / Media / third-party data to develop Data Science solutions for implementation and standardization in production environments.
Support the development of end-to-end analytical approaches based on product concepts
Actively share Data Science knowledge within the Technology and Data network
Support the presentation of GfK’s Data Science capabilities in client-facing situations


Responsibilities:


Support the creation of product driven Data Science solutions by closely collaborating with product manager / owner
Contribute to Data Science projects by developing and implementing Data Science & machine learning models that are reproducible, well documented, and follow prescribed coding guidelines
Participate in Communities of Practice
Create and improve methods and tools and contribute to best practices in Data Science
Foster Data Science related knowledge exchange within NIQ


Qualifications

Essential Skills:


Master or PhD degree that reflects strong statistical / mathematical / computer science skills
Solid statistical skills. Either in survey statistics (sampling, non-response adjustments, Bayesian statistics), or econometric modeling (program evaluation, forecasting, economic theory, panel data), or causal inference
Basic knowledge of optimization and / or machine learning algorithms and / or deep learning algorithms
Solid knowledge of Python and the respective development tools / IDEs (e.g. Jupyter, PyCharm)


Desirable Skills:


Solid experience and working knowledge of the constantly evolving Data Science ecosystem and popular machine learning frameworks
First experience with common software engineering practices and framework (version control, testing, agile development / Scrum)
First experience with cloud computing environments (e.g. GCP) and productionizing machine learning models (e.g. expose as REST API, containerization, scalability, performance optimization)


Additional Information


Ability to think creatively in addressing analytical objectives
Ability to fluidly communicate in an English business environment
First relevant work experience (e.g., through internships)
Ability to fluidly communicate in an English business environment


Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We're seeking a Data Scientist with a strong background in building document analysis applications using LLMs (OpenAI API) and/or rule-based methods. You'll leverage Python, SQL, handle various document formats, implement RAG and Knowledge Graphs, work with Azure Document Intelligence, and develop REST APIs. Strong coding and communication skills are essential.




Job Description:-

Responsibilities:

Develop document analysis applications using LLMs and/or rules.
Process PDF, Excel, Word files; implement RAG and Knowledge Graphs.
Utilize OpenAI API and Azure Document Intelligence.
Build REST APIs and Python applications with strong coding practices.
Collaborate and communicate effectively.

Qualifications:

Strong Python and SQL skills.
Experience with LLMs (OpenAI API), RAG, and document handling.
Software development experience with REST APIs.
Good communication skills.

Nice to Have: Databricks, insurance/cyber knowledge.




About Us:

Ascendion is a global, leading provider of AI-first software engineering services, delivering transformative solutions across North America, APAC, and Europe. We are headquartered in New Jersey. We combine technology and talent to deliver tech debt relief, improve engineering productivity solutions, and accelerate time to value, driving our clients’ digital journeys with efficiency and velocity. Guided by our “Engineering to the power of AI” [EngineeringAI] methodology, we integrate AI into software engineering, enterprise operations, and talent orchestration, to address critical challenges of trust, speed, and capital. For more information, please go to www.ascendion.com




With Ascendion (www.ascendion.com), you:

Will get to work on numerous challenging and exciting projects on our various offerings including Salesforce, AI/Data Science, Generative AI/ML, Automation, Cloud Enterprise and Product/Platform Engineering.
At Ascendion you have high chances of project extension or redeployment to other clients.
Additionally, you can also share CV of anyone you know. We have a referral policy in place.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Match Profiler is an Information Systems consultant who has been working in the national and international market since 1999. We have multidisciplinary skills and IT know-how that allow us to contribute, optimize and progress with our clients.

We are currently recruiting, for integration in our internal team/client, professionals with the following profile:




Data Scientist (m/f) – Hybrid (Lisbon)




What do you need to have:

Hard Skills:

• Higher education in a STEM related field, with major statistics or mathematics components

• Five to ten years of experience in Data Science / ML projects

• Professional experience in end-to-end data science / machine learning initiatives, encompassing data understanding, preparation, modelling and evaluation, and deployment. This is mandatory.

• Senior Level - Solid command of data science concepts and principles - especially around EDA, modelling and evaluation - is mandatory.

• Professional experience with Python and industry standard Python data science / ML frameworks (e.g. scikit, pytorch, keras, opencv, pandas, others) is mandatory

• Professional experience in data preparation/transformation (e.g. SQL, pandas) is mandatory.

• Professional experience working with a cloud environment is mandatory, AWS highly preferred.

• Experience with LLM, RAG, and Generative AI technologies is highly preferred.

• Professional experience with Databricks is highly valued

• Excellent fluency in English, written and spoken, is mandatory. All business discussions will be conducted in English.




Soft skills

• Good communication

• Team spirit

• Proactivity

• Time management




What we can offer:

• Personalized support from your team

• Your manager will take into consideration your motivations and suggestions

• Victories will be celebrated together

• Your HR and Support Teams will always be available to help

• Constant feedback on your work

• A network of hundreds of partnerships with companies from numerous sectors that offer you exclusive discounts (health, well-being, travel, gastronomy, culture, leisure, training, etc)

• And, of course, many gatherings and social events




To respond to this opportunity, send us your CV to the following e-mail address rita.marques@m-profiler.pt

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!




Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world’s leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of Aon, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?




What you will do

We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic Data Science team. Our mission is to drive innovation and leverage machine learning and data-driven solutions to solve strategic business challenges. You will work across various domains, including product, sales, marketing, and operations, impacting business outcomes at scale. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys solving complex problems, and is passionate about learning and leveraging data science to create real-world impact.




A typical day

Develop predictive models, advanced analytics solutions, and visualization tools for internal teams and end customers. Initial projects may include: scoring models for sales and customer service, recommendation systems, automation of repetitive tasks to improve efficiency.
Conduct complex analyses for business stakeholders, translating insights into actionable recommendations.
Own the feedback loop for testing and improving machine learning models.
Design, propose, and measure A/B tests for product features, ensuring alignment with business goals.
Identify data-driven opportunities to enhance different stages of the customer journey.
Collaborate with data engineering and infrastructure teams to develop scalable, end-to-end solutions.
Serve as a technical representative when engaging with external stakeholders.
Recommend and implement new technologies, processes, and systems to optimize efficiencies and business performance.
Maintain awareness of emerging trends in data science, machine learning, and technology.
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
Produce detailed technical documentation and presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.




What you need to succeed

BSc/BA in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Physics, Engineering, or a related field.
Around 4 - 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist
Strong communication skills to translate technical analysis into business insights.
Extensive experience with Python and data visualization frameworks (e.g., Plotly, Seaborn, Matplotlib).
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with data modeling and statistical analysis.
Familiarity with cloud environments (Google Cloud, AWS, etc.).
Experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment processes.
Solid understanding of clean code principles and version control (Git).
Knowledge of Docker and containerization technologies.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
Nice to have: Experience in designing and measuring A/B tests.
Nice to have: Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications.
Nice to have: Knowledge of best practices around service-oriented architectures or microservices.




About the recruitment process

Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
Do we have a match? Let’s move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the colleagues from the Data Science team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day life is and its responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Scientist as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level and you will have a maximum of 7 days to complete it.
If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet one of our Heads of Data and Engineering, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.




Why CoverWallet

At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations! And just for good measure…




💰 Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
⏰ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it’s up to you!
🎁 Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
📚 Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500€ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
🛒 Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform (BigPocket) on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
🏝 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
🍏 Great offices in Madrid, Valencia and Sevilla. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.







At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Scientist to join us in Lisbon.




Must Have:

Higher education in a STEM related field, with major statistics or mathematics components
Five to ten years of experience in Data Science / ML projects
Professional experience in end-to-end data science / machine learning initiatives, encompassing data understanding, preparation, modelling and evaluation, and deployment. This is mandatory.
Level - Solid command of data science concepts and principles - especially around EDA, modelling and evaluation - is mandatory.
Excellent fluency in English, written and spoken, is mandatory. All business discussions will be conducted in English.
Professional experience with Python and industry standard Python data science / ML frameworks (e.g. Professional experience in data preparation/transformation (e.g. SQL, pandas) is mandatory.
Professional experience working with a cloud environment is mandatory, AWS highly preferred.
Experience with LLM, RAG, and Generative AI technologies is highly preferred.
Professional experience with Databricks is highly valued




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to joana.ramos@decskill.com







Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Scientist to join us in Lisbon.


Must Have:

  • Higher education in a STEM related field, with major statistics or mathematics components
  • Five to ten years of experience in Data Science / ML projects
  • Professional experience in end-to-end data science / machine learning initiatives, encompassing data understanding, preparation, modelling and evaluation, and deployment. This is mandatory.
  • Level - Solid command of data science concepts and principles - especially around EDA, modelling and evaluation - is mandatory.
  • Excellent fluency in English, written and spoken, is mandatory. All business discussions will be conducted in English.
  • Professional experience with Python and industry standard Python data science / ML frameworks (e.g. Professional experience in data preparation/transformation (e.g. SQL, pandas) is mandatory.
  • Professional experience working with a cloud environment is mandatory, AWS highly preferred.
  • Experience with LLM, RAG, and Generative AI technologies is highly preferred.
  • Professional experience with Databricks is highly valued


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to joana.ramos@decskill.com



Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Standort: Region Ostwestfalen / Hybrid

Über das Unternehmen:
Ein etabliertes Technologieunternehmen mit einem klaren Fokus auf innovative KI-Lösungen sucht zur Verstärkung des Machine Learning & Data Science-Teams einen Machine Learning Engineer (m/w/d). In einem interdisziplinären Umfeld werden hier maßgeschneiderte KI-Modelle entwickelt, die reale Geschäftsprozesse intelligent unterstützen und automatisieren.
Hinter den Kulissen laufen zahlreiche KI-gestützte Systeme, die unternehmensspezifisch trainiert werden - mit besonderem Fokus auf Datenschutz und hohe Verfügbarkeit.
Das Machine Learning & Data Science-Team ist zentraler Treiber der digitalen Transformation und entwickelt Prototypen und produktive Lösungen für anspruchsvolle Anwendungsfälle.

Ihre Aufgaben:


Entwicklung und Optimierung von Machine-Learning-Modellen mit Fokus auf Natural Language Processing (NLP), Retriever, Transformer und Computer Vision

Identifikation, Extraktion und Aufbereitung von Daten aus verschiedenen Systemen, einschließlich großer, strukturierter und unstrukturierter Datenbestände

Prototyping und Implementierung von KI-gestützten Such- und Matching-Algorithmen, die personalisierte Ergebnisse und Empfehlungen in Echtzeit liefern

Mitgestaltung und technologische Weiterentwicklung des neu entstehenden Data Warehouse, inklusive Integration bestehender Daten aus ERP-Systemen

Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen zur Erarbeitung neuer Machine Learning Use Cases - von intelligenten Suchstrategien bis hin zu komplexen Empfehlungssystemen



Ihr Profil:


Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Data Science oder einem verwandten Fachgebiet oder entsprechende Berufserfahrung

Fundierte Kenntnisse in Machine Learning, insbesondere in den Bereichen NLP, RAG, Transformer und Computer Vision

Fähigkeit zur eigenständigen Datenrecherche und -verarbeitung aus komplexen Datenquellen

Erfahrung mit gängigen ML-Frameworks (z. B. TensorFlow, PyTorch) und Programmierkenntnisse in Python

Proaktive und kommunikative Persönlichkeit mit Freude an interdisziplinärer Zusammenarbeit und technologischer Weiterentwicklung

Interesse an Prototyping und der Entwicklung neuer KI-basierter Lösungen



Das erwartet Sie:


Innovative Projekte: Arbeiten Sie an zukunftsweisenden Machine-Learning-Anwendungen, die reale Geschäftsprozesse optimieren

Technologische Vielfalt: Nutzen Sie modernste ML-Technologien und gestalten Sie aktiv den Aufbau eines leistungsfähigen Data Warehouse mit

Eigenverantwortung & Gestaltungsspielraum: Bringen Sie Ihre Ideen ein und treiben Sie innovative Lösungen voran

Stabilität & Sicherheit: Arbeiten Sie in einem technologieorientierten Umfeld mit eigenem Rechenzentrum



Möchten Sie die Zukunft von KI-gestützten Systemen aktiv mitgestalten? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!
Jetzt bewerben und die Zukunft intelligenter Technologien mitentwickeln!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Een baan als Machine Learning Engineer bij Digital Power

Als Machine Learning Engineer speel je een sleutelrol in het ontwikkelen en operationaliseren van geavanceerde AI-oplossingen. Je werkt samen met een team van gedreven data-experts en hebt de vrijheid om jouw expertise in te zetten waar het écht impact maakt. Bovendien krijg je de kans om jezelf continu te ontwikkelen en te groeien binnen een innovatieve werkomgeving.

Wat ga je doen?

Schaalbare en betrouwbare machine learning-oplossingen implementeren in productieomgevingen.
Ontwerpen, bouwen en optimaliseren van machine learning-modellen voor diverse business cases.
Werken met tools zoals Databricks, en cloudplatforms zoals AWS, Azure of GCP om machine learning-oplossingen te hosten en te beheren.
Integreren van machine learning-modellen met bestaande data pipelines en IT-infrastructuur.
Samenwerken met data scientists, data engineers en stakeholders om de best mogelijke oplossingen te realiseren.
Bewaken van modelprestaties en continu verbeteren op basis van nieuwe data en inzichten.










Wie we zoeken

Je hebt een achtergrond in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science of een vergelijkbare richting.
Je hebt kennis van MLOps en weet hoe je machine learning-modellen efficiënt in productie brengt en onderhoudt. Je hebt ervaring met het opzetten van CI/CD, tracking, en monitoring.
Je hebt ervaring met programmeertalen zoals Python en frameworks als TensorFlow, PyTorch of Scikit-learn.
Ervaring met cloudplatforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) en data warehousing (Databricks, Snowflake)
Je bent analytisch sterk, oplossingsgericht en communiceert helder met zowel technische als niet-technische stakeholders.
Je hebt affiniteit met data en bent altijd op zoek naar manieren om machine learning toepasbaar en waardevol te maken.




What else?

Je hecht veel waarde aan het delen van je kennis.
Je vindt een goede sfeer op de werkvloer net zo belangrijk als je vak.
Je krijgt goede energie van onze ‘werken bij’ pagina.
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal goed in woord en geschrift
Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding




Heb je nog niet alle technische skills in huis, maar ben je sterk gemotiveerd om Machine Learning Engineer te worden? Solliciteer gewoon! Er zijn binnen Digital Power genoeg mogelijkheden om je op te leiden.




Wat we bieden

We bieden een startsalaris van € 3695 – € 6990 bruto per maand, afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring.
Een omgeving met meer dan 120 dataspecialisten, waaronder 20 data- en MLOps-engineers, die beschikbaar zijn voor jouw ontwikkeling.
De mogelijkheid om junioren/medioren te begeleiden in hun ontwikkeling.
Een eigen leeromgeving in AWS, Azure en GCP.
Onbeperkt opleidingsbudget voor het behalen van extra certificeringen.
Je eigen werktijden indelen.
Kijk hier wat we je allemaal nog meer bieden.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are HCLTech, one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world and home to 219,000+ people across 54 countries, supercharging progress through industry-leading capabilities centered around Digital, Engineering and Cloud.




The driving force behind that work, our people, are diverse, creative, and passionate, raising the bar for excellence on a regular basis. We, in turn, work hard to bring out the best in them as we strive to help them find their spark and become the best version of themselves that they can be.




If all this sounds like an environment you’ll thrive in, then you’re in the right place. Join us on our journey to advancing the technological world through innovation and creativity.

______________________________________________________________

Qualifications & Experience

You have a proven track record of successful hands-on experiences in the area of advanced analytics. Education in data science without previous practical hands-on experience will not be accepted.
You are proficient in Python. Knowledge of Scala and/or Spark is a plus.
You are proficient in relational database querying (SQL) or in data collection and transformation (ETL).
You master analytical techniques such as machine learning, natural language processing, mathematical optimization, large language models…
You are at ease with visualization tools like Power BI.
You have experience with command line tools (UNIX) and version control tools like GIT.
You know the Hadoop ecosystem (knowledge of the Cloudera distribution of Hadoop will be a plus).
You have work experience with at least one Cloud Provider, preferably Azure Cloud.
You have strong verbal and written communication skills as well as good customer relationship skills to present the results of a use case to different audiences (from end users up to division management). You are able to explain complex concepts in a simplified manner.
You have experience implementing advanced analytics solutions into a well-controlled production environment.
You are able to learn quickly, adjust to changes and think outside the box.
You are self-motivated and confident with a positive attitude.
You have excellent time management and organizational skills, with attention to details.
You have a past experience in agile development methodologies and make sure that the deliverables contribute to the final product.
You stay abreast of new tools and technologies to practice up-to-date data analytic strategies.

In addition

Master's degree in machine learning, statistics, applied mathematics, or a related quantitative field, combined with strong IT skills. A relevant PhD can be valorised.
5+ years of experience in advanced data analytics.
5+ years of experience in Python.







Why Us?

We are one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world, with offices in 50+ countries across the globe and 219,000 employees
Our company is extremely diverse with 165 nationalities represented
We offer the opportunity to work with colleagues across the globe
We offer a virtual-first work environment, promoting a good work-life integration and real flexibility
We are invested in your growth, offering learning and career development opportunities at every level to help you find your own unique spark




Benefit package

Life insurance
Private medical care
MultiSport Card
Subsidy for glasses
Subsidy to language courses
Christmas and holiday bonuses
Clear career path in a growing multinational organization

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Docsity is an educational community where millions of university students share and find study content to improve their exam preparation. Our mission is to help students to be more effective in their preparation, and connect them with meaningful learning opportunities.




With Docsity AI, we are transforming how students interact with educational content through artificial intelligence. Our AI-powered platform provides advanced tools such as learning copilot, conceptual map, automated quiz generation, and document summarization, making learning more interactive and efficient.




We are looking for a Data Scientist who is passionate about learning, data, scalability, and agility. You will play a key role in shaping Docsity AI by leveraging data science techniques to optimize learning experiences and drive data-informed decisions across the company.




🎯Your daily activities will include:

Analyze raw data: assess quality, cleanse, and structure it for downstream product processing.
Develop architectures to streamline data science processes and ensure scalability.
Support initiatives for data integrity, normalization, and governance.
Enhance Docsity AI by developing machine learning algorithms for personalization and content recommendations.
Promote data-driven decision-making across the company through reports and presentations.
Develop insightful dashboards to track performance and key metrics.
Monitor and evaluate AI models, iterating based on user feedback.




🏆 Ideal Candidate:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.).
Solid understanding of product metrics and the product development cycle, ensuring data insights align with business objectives.
Proficiency in Python, Pandas, and database technologies (SQL, schema design, query optimization).
Experience with Large Language Models APIs and frameworks like LangChain, LlamaIndex, LandGraph, or other Copilot frameworks.
Understanding of the full software development life cycle and agile development methodologies.
Proficiency in Italian and English (B2+ level or higher).

Nice to have

Experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling.
Expertise in BI tools (Looker, Looker Data Studio, Tableau, AWS QuickSight).
Knowledge of Ecommerce and digital marketing metrics.
Experience with scalable analytics techniques (PySpark, Dask, Modin, Koalas) and MPP databases (BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).




✨ What’s in it for you?

Work with tons of data, to which you will have full access
Work closely with all functions within the organization
Work in a highly skilled, organized, and cross-functional Data Team
Opportunity to grow personally and professionally through training and peer interaction
Hybrid work structure: 3 days in the office and 2 days of smart working per week




Place of work: Lungo Po Diaz, Torino

Salary and contract based on seniority.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Sei pronto per una nuova sfida? In Global Technologies Italia progettiamo e sviluppiamo trasformazioni digitali. Collaboriamo con partner nazionali e internazionali per potenziare i processi integrando al meglio le tecnologie ai sistemi operativi.




Per un nostro importante cliente siamo alla ricerca di un Data Scientist che lavorerà in modalità ibrida (Torino).




Skills:

Esperienza su dati audio e video
Discreta conoscenza della Lingua Inglese
Gradita conoscenza di Python, Logger, RTMAPS o software ambito automotive




Completano il profilo:

Orientamento al teamwork e al raggiungimento dei risultati
Proattività
Motivazione ed interesse verso nuove tecnologie




Cosa Offriamo:

Assunzione a tempo determinato allineata alle competenze e all’esperienza del candidato.




Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger—and moving faster. We’re a family-founded company on a mission to create the world’s first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal in 2018—and now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco—we’ve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you’ll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management—and change lives along the way.

The Role

As an AI/ML Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and optimizing machine learning models to power our mobile applications. You will work closely with product managers, engineers, and designers to create intelligent, data-driven features that enhance user experiences. Your expertise in artificial intelligence and deep learning will help us innovate and stay ahead in the mobile app industry.

Please note that this post serves the purpose of enhancing our talent pool while we prepare to launch the official job. As soon as it gets posted we will get in touch with you.

Responsibilities


Develop, train, and optimize machine learning models for various mobile app features.
Research and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques to improve user engagement and app performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI-driven solutions into our applications.
Design and maintain scalable ML pipelines, ensuring efficient model deployment and monitoring.
Analyze large datasets to derive insights and drive data-driven decision-making.
Stay updated with the latest AI trends and best practices, incorporating them into our development processes.
Optimize AI models for mobile environments to ensure high performance and low latency.


Requirements


Around 3+ years of experience in AI/ML development, preferably in mobile applications.
Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or other ML frameworks.
Experience with deep learning, NLP, computer vision, and statistical modeling.
Familiarity with cloud-based ML services (AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure).
Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering best practices.
Experience in deploying and maintaining ML models in production.
Ability to work collaboratively in a remote team environment.
Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation.


What benefits do we offer?


Remote-first approach with flexible working hours.
Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) to support work-life balance.
Annual Bonus
Top-tier Health Insurance for peace of mind.
Public Transportation Pass to support your commute needs.
Coverflex benefits package for meal allowances, well-being, and more.
Air Conference 2025 in Las Vegas – an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.


Diversity & Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.


Show more
HTML:
About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger—and moving faster. We’re a family-founded company on a mission to create the world’s first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal in 2018—and now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco—we’ve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you’ll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management—and change lives along the way.

The Role

As an AI/ML Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and optimizing machine learning models to power our mobile applications. You will work closely with product managers, engineers, and designers to create intelligent, data-driven features that enhance user experiences. Your expertise in artificial intelligence and deep learning will help us innovate and stay ahead in the mobile app industry.

Please note that this post serves the purpose of enhancing our talent pool while we prepare to launch the official job. As soon as it gets posted we will get in touch with you.

Responsibilities

  • Develop, train, and optimize machine learning models for various mobile app features.
  • Research and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques to improve user engagement and app performance.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI-driven solutions into our applications.
  • Design and maintain scalable ML pipelines, ensuring efficient model deployment and monitoring.
  • Analyze large datasets to derive insights and drive data-driven decision-making.
  • Stay updated with the latest AI trends and best practices, incorporating them into our development processes.
  • Optimize AI models for mobile environments to ensure high performance and low latency.

Requirements

  • Around 3+ years of experience in AI/ML development, preferably in mobile applications.
  • Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or other ML frameworks.
  • Experience with deep learning, NLP, computer vision, and statistical modeling.
  • Familiarity with cloud-based ML services (AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure).
  • Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering best practices.
  • Experience in deploying and maintaining ML models in production.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a remote team environment.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation.

What benefits do we offer?

  • Remote-first approach with flexible working hours.
  • Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
  • Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) to support work-life balance.
  • Annual Bonus
  • Top-tier Health Insurance for peace of mind.
  • Public Transportation Pass to support your commute needs.
  • Coverflex benefits package for meal allowances, well-being, and more.
  • Air Conference 2025 in Las Vegas – an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a talented 🧙‍♂️...




What’s in it for you?

🎉 Competitive salary package ranging up to €90K per year

🕒 Flexible/hybrid working arrangements tailored around your needs

🌱 Opportunity for professional development within an exciting startup atmosphere

❤️ A friendly, down-to-earth culture where collaboration is at the heat of the organisation




As our next Data Scientist:

You’ll develop powerful machine learning algorithms based on rich datasets derived from various aspects of digital marketing strategies!
You’ll focus heavily on improving/testing those critical ingestion flows tied directly back towards MMMs & attribution models while maintaining optimal performance throughout all stages!
Collaborate closely across teams ensuring seamless integration between developers/data scientists driving forward-thinking solutions aimed towards global expansion initiatives.




It would be fantastic if you…

🔍 Are well known with Marketing Mix Modelling techniques AND have hands-on familiarity deploying ML solutions effectively!

🐍 Have experience using Python (almost goes without saying, haha), Pandas and PySpark.

📈 Hold around 2–3 years’ of experience working within real-world applications… plus bonus points if you've dabbled inside AWS/Databricks realms too!




If you're looking not just for any job - but one where you thrive in "Build the plane while flying" → Your journey starts here… 🚀

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Hi! 👋🏼

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for an AI Engineer to take our Product team to the next level 🚀

1. Team and Role

If you have experience in developing AI systems, thrive in dynamic startup environments, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to gain full experience within a rapidly growing startup. We are a small, highly committed team with strong connections to other teams, so you'll have the chance to learn and grow quickly. There's a lot to be done! If you're excited about working in an innovative and fast-paced environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is your opportunity! 🤩



2. What you´ll be doing

Your day-to-day as an AI Engineer

As an AI Engineer, you will work hand in hand with one of our aquads to contribute to the key areas of the AI team, primarily:

Development of conversational systems: You will design, implement, and optimize AI products, chatbots, and virtual assistants that enhance the experience of our users.
Integration of third-party AI APIs: You will work with APIs such as OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini AI, etc., integrating them effectively into our solutions.
Implementation of RAG systems (Retrieval Augmented Generation): You will create systems that combine knowledge bases with generative models for precise and contextualized responses.
Development with specialized libraries: You will use LangChain, LlamaIndex, LangFlow, and our own framework to build robust and scalable AI solutions.
Model evaluation and testing: You will implement evaluation methodologies to continuously measure and improve the performance of our models.
Cost and performance optimization: You will work on continuously improving our AI systems, balancing quality, speed, and operational costs.
Cross-disciplinary collaboration: You will work with product, engineering, and business teams to align AI solutions with strategic objectives.
Applied research: You will stay up-to-date with the latest advances in AI and evaluate new technologies for potential implementation.




3. What we´re looking for

We need someone who...

Has 2-4 years of experience programming AI solutions in Python, especially in startup or tech company environments.
Has experience with conversational systems and chatbots using large language models (LLMs).
Has worked with third-party AI APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Hugging Face, etc.).
Has experience in prompt engineering, dynamic prompt declaration, CoT, and self-evaluation methods.

It’s very important that you...

Are familiar with and have implemented RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) systems.
Have experience with libraries like LangChain, LlamaIndex, or LangFlow.
Follow best development practices: version control, documentation, unit testing, etc.
Are up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in generative AI.

You’re perfect for us if you also have experience in...

Knowledge of Docker, CI/CD, deployment, and DevOps.
Knowledge of ML, predictive AI, recommendation systems.
Experience working with cloud providers such as AWS Bedrock, Microsoft Azure, or Gemini Vertex.
Experience building APIs with frameworks like FastAPI or similar.
Experience implementing testing and evaluation methodologies for AI models.




4. What's in it for you?

Compensation 💰

The salary range for this position is between 26.000€ and 46.000€ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

Between 26.000€ & 40.000€ fixed salary.
Up to 15% (6.000€) quarterly bonus based on performance & potential.

Why you´ll love working at Shakers 💚

Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. 🌍
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture—ask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Velázquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... 📍

Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine

5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this May, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!


The Road to Joining Our Team


Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don’t worry—we just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet Héctor, our CEO! He’s excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers’ future, and discuss your vision and expectations.
More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!



Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM 🏆

We all feel like part of a winning team—one that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 💪🏼

We’re building an environment where fear doesn’t hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren’t afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE 🤲🏼

We embrace a beginner’s mindset—always evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!




A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Gruppo BV TECH è un gruppo innovativo, fondato nel 2005, interamente italiano ed uno dei principali attori del mercato italiano dell’Information & Communication Technology e della Sicurezza delle Informazioni.




Il Gruppo comprende società di ingegneria, servizi informatici e sicurezza con più di 1000 dipendenti e ha sedi su tutto il territorio italiano (le principali a Milano, Roma, Genova e Grottaglie) e internazionale (Londra e Boston).




Particolarmente focalizzato sui temi della Cybersecurity, il gruppo è partner fondatore di (IC)3, il consorzio creato dal Massachusetts Institute of Technology (ora Cybersecurity At MIT Sloan - CAMS) per diffondere e sviluppare la cultura della sicurezza informatica nel settore della protezione delle infrastrutture critiche.




Il Gruppo BV TECH sviluppa tecnologie «nazionali» nel settore ICT in ambito sia civile sia militare (C4ISTAR), con l’ambizione di contribuire significativamente all’innovazione e alla crescita del Paese.




Le principali aree di expertise del Gruppo BV TECH sono:

Sviluppo soluzioni
Ingegneria
Progettazione dei sistemi di sicurezza dei dati e delle informazioni.
Gestione Servizi, assistenza tecnica e gestione operativa di sistemi e reti.
Prodotti e Tecnologie, Sistemi per la Cybersecurity e per la comunicazione sicura




La figura ricercata è un* Senior AI/ML Engineer




Si occuperà di:

Progettare, sviluppare e distribuire modelli e algoritmi di machine learning per diverse applicazioni.
Collaborare con data scientist e ingegneri per pre-elaborare e analizzare grandi dataset. Implementare e ottimizzare pipeline e flussi di lavoro di machine learning.
Condurre ricerche ed esperimenti per avanzare lo stato dell'arte nel machine learning e nell'intelligenza artificiale.
Valutare e selezionare strumenti e framework di machine learning appropriati.
Distribuire modelli di machine learning in ambienti di produzione e monitorarne le prestazioni.
Sviluppare e mantenere la documentazione per i progetti di machine learning.
Rimanere aggiornati sui più recenti progressi nelle tecnologie e metodologie AI/ML.




Titolo di studio richiesto:

Laurea specialistica: in Ingegneria Informatica, Data Science, Machine Learning/IA, Matematica/Statistica, Informatica o discipline affini (STEM).




Responsabilità Chiave

Progettare, sviluppare e distribuire modelli di IA generativa all'avanguardia per diverse applicazioni
Collaborare con data scientist e ingegneri per ottimizzare i dati di addestramento per sistemi di IA generativa
Implementare e perfezionare pipeline e flussi di lavoro di IA generativa
Condurre ricerche ed esperimenti per avanzare lo stato dell'arte nelle tecniche di IA generativa
Valutare e selezionare framework e strumenti appropriati per lo sviluppo di IA generativa
Distribuire modelli di IA generativa in ambienti di produzione e monitorarne le metriche di prestazione
Sviluppare e mantenere la documentazione per progetti di IA generativa
Rimanere aggiornati sui più recenti progressi nelle tecnologie e metodologie di IA generativa




Qualifiche Essenziali

Linguaggi di Programmazione: Forte competenza in Python, con esperienza in framework specificamente progettati per l'IA generativa
Framework di IA Generativa: Esperienza pratica con PyTorch, TensorFlow o framework simili per costruire e addestrare modelli generativi
Large Language Models: Esperienza nel fine-tuning, ottimizzazione e distribuzione di LLM (es. architetture basate su transformer)
Prompt Engineering: Competenza nella progettazione, test e ottimizzazione di prompt per sistemi di IA generativa
Valutazione dei Modelli: Conoscenza approfondita delle metriche di valutazione specifiche per modelli generativi e tecniche per migliorare la qualità dell'output
Algoritmi Generativi: Solida comprensione delle architetture transformer, modelli di diffusione, GAN e altri approcci generativi
Analisi Statistica: Solida base nelle distribuzioni di probabilità e tecniche di campionamento rilevanti per i modelli generativi
Soluzioni di Scalabilità: Esperienza con tecniche per la distribuzione efficiente di grandi modelli generativi
Piattaforme Cloud: Competenza nella distribuzione e gestione di modelli di IA generativa su piattaforme cloud come AWS, Azure o Google Cloud
Risoluzione dei Problemi: Eccellenti capacità analitiche con focus su soluzioni creative per le sfide dell'IA generativa
Comunicazione: Ottime competenze di comunicazione scritta e verbale per spiegare efficacemente i concetti di IA generativa
Lingue: Indispensabile la conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese professionali




Qualifiche Preferenziali

Elaborazione del Linguaggio Naturale: Esperienza con LangChain, Hugging Face Transformers e altri framework NLP per applicazioni di testo generativo
Sistemi Multimodali: Esperienza nella costruzione di sistemi che possono generare o lavorare su più modalità (testo, immagine, audio)
Architetture di Modelli Generativi: Profonda competenza in modelli di diffusione, GAN, VAE, modelli basati su flusso e architetture basate su transformer
MLOps per IA Generativa: Esperienza con pipeline di distribuzione specificamente ottimizzate per grandi modelli generativi
Pratiche di Sviluppo Software: Solida esperienza in ingegneria del software con focus sullo sviluppo di robuste applicazioni di IA generativa
Tecniche Avanzate: Comprensione di tecniche come RLHF, IA costituzionale e altre metodologie di allineamento
Sviluppo API: Esperienza nella creazione e ottimizzazione di API per la distribuzione di modelli di IA generativa
Ottimizzazione dei Costi: Esperienza con distillazione dei modelli, quantizzazione e altre tecniche per ridurre i costi di inferenza
Versionamento di Dati e Modelli: Esperienza nel tracciamento delle versioni dei modelli generativi e dei loro dati di addestramento
Contributi alla Ricerca: Pubblicazioni o contributi a progetti open-source di IA generativa
IA Etica: Familiarità con pratiche di IA responsabile specifiche per modelli generativi, inclusa la mitigazione dei bias, la sicurezza e il filtraggio dei contenuti
Sistemi RAG: Esperienza nella costruzione di sistemi di generazione aumentata da recupero per migliorare le capacità di IA generativa




Cosa offriamo:

Inquadramento a tempo indeterminato e retribuzione commisurata all’effettiva esperienza nel ruolo
Un ambiente di lavoro stimolante e sfidante che punta a valorizzare le tue competenze e qualità, che premia la proattività e lo spirito di collaborazione




Pacchetto benefit base:

Laptop aziendale
Formazione - certificazioni tecnico specifiche
buoni pasto
Assicurazione sanitaria
smart working




Il presente annuncio è rivolto a candidati ambosessi (L.903/77 - D. Lgs. n.198/2006)

I candidati ambosessi L. 903/77 – D.Lgs. n. 198/2006, sono invitati a leggere informativa privacy ex art.13 REG. UE 2016/679
